q: former business partners, Simon Fuller and Simon Cowell Jones, met with an unnamed network years ago. "It was so bad that a minute into the pitch the guy said, "No..." he recalled. He said you can leave now, and I said,` So it sounds to me that you don't like the show?' And he said,` Get out.' And I said,` So should we come back next week?' And he said,` Get out." "We were basically thrown out of the network, Simon Cowell said. "The good news is, it would never get worse than this." Fox went on to premiere American Idol in 2002. Chris Bryant, who believes he may have been a victim of the phone hackers, said Friday he welcomed the decision to re-examine the case, adding that it should not have been closed last month. The evidence that this goes far deeper than one rotten apple has continued to stack up, and so a fresh pair of eyes looking at the case is very welcome, he said. Bryant said the police had "severely" damaged their credibility by failing to properly investigate earlier. Andy Coulson and the News of The World have denied the charges. THQ
